resources.string: Passive mode disables location services in this app to conserve battery.
Your security app is in Passive mode and will need to be active to send real time location details
Once active, you can alert others of your situation and location to get timely help.
Your security app is in Active mode. Shake the phone or use the button to alert others in case of emergency.
Enter your passcode to make passive.
I-DARE will send an SMS message to verify your phone number. Please enter your phone number:

We will be verifying the phone number : 

%1$s 

Is this OK, or would you like to edit the number?
You have received a 6 digit pin via SMS. Please enter to verify your number.
Are you sure you want to log out?
No location detected. Make sure location is enabled on the device.
"The active mode wants to access your location."
Please select your safe houses that you would like to find in the vicinity.
Please enter the phone number of the user you want to add to you core list

I-Dare acknowledges the climate of danger and risk, with associated physical violence, that women regularly face in public spaces, in Bangalore. The app facilitates and encourages individual safe practices and organises fearless participation by its women members, to personally, and pro-actively respond to safety alert from any member in distress. The tool is neither comprehensive nor fool-proof, but is a small affirmative step forward to having women reclaim their right to personal public safety, and take collective action in making this so.I-Dare is a voluntary initiative and therefore, no one person or collective of persons shall be held responsible for the functioning, effectiveness or consequences of using this app.

I-dare is not a law enforcement or a rescue agency (put also in terms and conditions) that can guarantee successful rescue of women in distress. We comprise of a pool of empowered women members, the I-dare users, who volunteer to respond, when possible, to an SOS alert from any member in their vicinity. The goal is to change the mindset of women from mere victims of the current social circumstances and violence to that of a collective strength which says enough is enough! As memberships increases, so will the efficacy of this app, with sufficient members to alert in vicinity of a potential crime. This app is only a technical facilitator of this process.

Membership is open only to women by Direct Invitation from an existing I-Dare member. Invitation goes out as a Unique, single-use SMS which is not forwardable and may be used by that number only. The SMS contains a link which takes the person directly to the I-Dare App HOME page where a new member may register.
A martial arts saying: Best form of self defense is not putting yourself in a situation where you need to defend yourself.
BE WARNED: ABUSE VIA SOCIAL MEDIA
Arati Chokshi is a retd Astrophysicist, human rightsâ€™ activist, with interests & experiences in the fields of natural farming, education, environment protection.

I-dare emerged out of a deep sense of alarm, fear and impotence at the increasing levels of crimes reported against women, in public spaces. It compelled us to respond to this violence, carefully, critically, and strategically, not merely as individual prisoners, future victims, but as courageous, caring, and committed women who are collectively empowered to help themselves and each other in time of need.
I-dare dreams of a society that is not only safe, and just, but also deliberately caring , to step in and - Dare.
We are not funded. The app uses OSS and our aim is to make the app also freely available in future as OSS.
We rely on funding, however small, from people who agree with our vision.
